types.docs: Custom Element

props.name: contentType
props.docs: Content type of file.

props.name: extension
props.docs: Extension of file.

props.name: fileContent
props.docs: the file content

props.name: filename
props.docs: Name of file.

props.name: href
props.docs:
URL where the file can be downloaded. Note that this is optional. If the
file cannot be directly accessed via a unique url, this property should
be left undefined or set to `null`.

props.name: icon
props.docs: Name of the icon to use.

props.name: iconBackgroundColor
props.docs: Background color of the icon. Overrides `--icon-background-color`.

docsTags.name: deprecated
docsTags.text:
This property is deprecated and will be removed soon!

Use the new `Icon` interface instead and write:
```ts
icon: {
   name: string,
   backgroundColor: string,
},
```

props.name: iconColor
props.docs: Icon color. Overrides `--icon-color`.

docsTags.name: deprecated
docsTags.text:
This property is deprecated and will be removed soon!

Use the new `Icon` interface instead and write:
```ts
icon: {
   name: string,
   color: string,
},
```

props.name: id
props.docs: ID of the file. Must be unique.

props.name: lastModified
props.docs: Date of last modification.

props.name: menuItems
props.docs: Custom menu items for the file.

props.name: size
props.docs: Size of file.

types.name: Icon
types.docs:
This interface is used to specify which icon to use in many components,
along with related properties, like color.

props.name: backgroundColor
props.docs: Background color of the icon.

props.name: color
props.docs: Color of the icon.

props.name: name
props.docs: Name of the icon, refers to the icon's filename in lime-icons8 repository.

props.name: title
props.docs:
Used primarily to improve accessibility for users who
take advantage of assistive technologies; but also
to clarify further what an icon tries to resemble
for sighted users.
Depending on the component which is using the `Icon` interface,
the `title` might be used as a `title` attribute on the
rendered icon element, as an `aria-label` attribute, or as a
`label` in a tooltip associated with the icon. Documentations
about the accessibility of the component should provide more
information about how the `title` is used.

types.name: Image
types.docs:
This interface is used to specify a path to an image,
along with related properties, like alt text.

props.name: alt
props.docs: The alternative text of the image, used to improve accessibility.

props.name: loading
props.docs:
The `loading` attribute of the image.
- `lazy` means that the image will be loaded only when it is in the viewport.
- `eager` means that the image will be loaded as soon as possible.

props.name: src
props.docs: The path to the image file.

types.name: Link
types.docs: Interface for a link.

props.name: href
props.docs: The url the link should point to.

props.name: rel
props.docs:
The `rel` attribute for the link.
Unless explicitly provided, in our components, this is
automatically set to `"noopener noreferrer"`
when `target="_blank"` is used, for improved security.
Providing an empty string will override the default.

props.name: target
props.docs:
Target for the link. See
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target
for more info.

props.name: text
props.docs:
The text value to use for the link.
Note that this might not be used by all components that use the
Link interface.

props.name: title
props.docs:
Title for the link. Read by assistive tech and shown when the
link is hovered. Can be used to provide additional information
about the link. It improves accessibility both for sighted users
and users of assistive technologies.

types.name: ListSeparator
types.docs:
Indicates that a separator should be rendered.
Used in lists and menus to separate items into sections.

props.name: separator
props.docs: Indicates that a separator should be rendered.

props.name: text
props.docs:
Text to display in the separator.
This can be used as a label for the section following the separator.
If not specified, the separator will be rendered without a label.

accessibleLabel.title: Accessible Label
accessibleLabel.description:
A label used to describe the purpose of the element to users
of assistive technologies, like screen readers.
Example value: "toolbar"

actions.title: Actions
actions.description:
Items that are placed in the action bar.
These represent primary actions.

collapsible.title: Collapsible
collapsible.description: When set to `true`, the action bar will be collapsible.

layout.title: Layout
layout.description:
- When set to `fullWidth`, the component will take the
entire width of its container.
- When set to `floating`, the component will get basic stylings
to visualize the floating state.
:::note
You should still properly position the component
according to the structure of your user interface.
For example, use an `absolute` or `fixed` position.
:::

openDirection.title: Open Direction
openDirection.description:
Defines the location that the content of the overflow menu
appears, in relation to its trigger.

isVisible.title: Is Visible
isVisible.description:
When the item is displayed in the available width,
this will be `false`.

item.title: Item
item.description: Item that is placed in the action bar.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description: When the item is selected, this will be `true`.

items.title: Items
items.description: List of the items that should be rendered in the overflow menu.

openDirection.title: Open Direction
openDirection.description:
Defines the location that the content of the overflow menu
appears, in relation to its trigger.
It defaults to `bottom-end`, since in normal scenarios
(for example when the action bar is not floating at the bottom of the screen)
this menu is the right-most item in the user interface of the component.

overFlowIcon.title: Over Flow Icon
overFlowIcon.description:
Icon to display in the overflow menu trigger.
If not provided, the number of items in the overflow menu will be displayed.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the icon, refers to the icon's filename in lime-icons8 repository.

title.title: Title
title.description:
Used primarily to improve accessibility for users who
take advantage of assistive technologies; but also
to clarify further what an icon tries to resemble
for sighted users.
Depending on the component which is using the `Icon` interface,
the `title` might be used as a `title` attribute on the
rendered icon element, as an `aria-label` attribute, or as a
`label` in a tooltip associated with the icon. Documentations
about the accessibility of the component should provide more
information about how the `title` is used.

isThinking.title: Is Thinking
isThinking.description:
Set to `true` to trigger animations that indicate that the AI is
"thinking" or processing something.

label.title: Label
label.description:
Label to display in the badge.
Numeric labels larger than 999 will be rounded and abbreviated.
String labels get truncated if their length is longer than
six characters.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Set icon for the banner

message.title: Message
message.description: The text to show on the banner.

divider.title: Divider
divider.description:
The visual divider that separates items.
It must be a single character such as `-` or `,`.

items.title: Items
items.description:
List of items in the breadcrumbs,
each representing a step or a page.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Icon of the step.

link.title: Link
link.description: If supplied, the breadcrumbs steps will be a clickable links.

type.title: Type
type.description:
If set to `icon-only`, the `text` will be rendered as a tooltip
and the item will only display the defined `icon`.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Set to `true` to disable the button.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Set icon for the button

label.title: Label
label.description: The text to show on the button.

loading.title: Loading
loading.description:
Set to `true` to put the button in the `loading` state.
This also disables the button.

loadingFailed.title: Loading Failed
loadingFailed.description:
Set to `true` to indicate failure instead of success when the button is
no longer in the `loading` state.

outlined.title: Outlined
outlined.description: Set to `true` to make the button outlined.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description: Set to `true` to make the button primary.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: True if the button-group should be disabled

value.title: Value
value.description: List of buttons for the group

badge.title: Badge
badge.description: The label displayed in the badge

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon to use

id.title: Id
id.description: ID of the button. Must be unique.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description: True if the button should be selected. only first button will be selected.

title.title: Title
title.description: Text or label title in the button.

heading.title: Heading
heading.description:
Heading of the callout, which can be used to override the
default heading which is displayed based on the chosen `type`.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description:
Icon of the callout, which can be used to override the
default icon which is displayed based on the chosen `type`.

language.title: Language
language.description:
Defines the language for translations.
Will translate the default headings for supported languages.

type.title: Type
type.description:
Defines how the component is visualized, for example
which heading, color or icon is used in its user interface.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description:
Actions to display in the card,
to provide the user with options to interact with the content.

clickable.title: Clickable
clickable.description:
When true, improve the accessibility of the component and hints the user
that the card can be interacted width.

heading.title: Heading
heading.description:
Heading of the card,
to provide a short title about the context.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: An icon, to display along with the heading and subheading.

image.title: Image
image.description:
A hero image to display in the card,
to enrich the content with visual information.

orientation.title: Orientation
orientation.description:
The orientation of the card,
specially useful when the card has an image.

subheading.title: Subheading
subheading.description:
Subheading of the card
to provide a short description of the context.

value.title: Value
value.description:
The content of the card.
Supports markdown, to provide a rich text experience.

alt.title: Alt
alt.description: The alternative text of the image, used to improve accessibility.

loading.title: Loading
loading.description:
The `loading` attribute of the image.
- `lazy` means that the image will be loaded only when it is in the viewport.
- `eager` means that the image will be loaded as soon as possible.

src.title: Src
src.description: The path to the image file.

accessibleItemsLabel.title: Accessible Items Label
accessibleItemsLabel.description:
Helps users of assistive technologies to understand
what the items in the chart represent.

accessibleLabel.title: Accessible Label
accessibleLabel.description:
Helps users of assistive technologies to understand
the context of the chart, and what is being displayed.

axisIncrement.title: Axis Increment
axisIncrement.description: Specifies the increment for the axis lines.

items.title: Items
items.description:
List of items in the chart,
each representing a data point.

language.title: Language
language.description:
Defines the language for translations.
Will translate the translatable strings on the components.

loading.title: Loading
loading.description: Indicates whether the chart is in a loading state.

maxValue.title: Max Value
maxValue.description:
Specifies the range that items' values could be in.
This is used in calculation of the size of the items in the chart.
When not provided, the sum of all values in the items will be considered as the range.

orientation.title: Orientation
orientation.description:
Defines whether the chart is intended to be displayed wide or tall.
Does not have any effect on chart types which generate circular forms.

type.title: Type
type.description: Defines how items are visualized in the chart.

checked.title: Checked
checked.description: The value of the checkbox. Set to `true` to make the checkbox checked.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description:
Disables the checkbox when `true`. Works exactly the same as `readonly`.
If either property is `true`, the checkbox will be disabled.

helperText.title: Helper Text
helperText.description: Optional helper text to display below the checkbox

indeterminate.title: Indeterminate
indeterminate.description: Enables indeterminate state. Set to `true` to signal indeterminate check.

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description: Set to `true` to indicate that the current value is invalid.

label.title: Label
label.description: The checkbox label.

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description:
Disables the checkbox when `true`. This visualizes the checkbox slightly differently.
But shows no visual sign indicating that the checkbox is disabled
or can ever become interactable.

readonlyLabels.title: Readonly Labels
readonlyLabels.description:
The labels to use to clarify what kind of data is being visualized,
when the component is `readonly`.

required.title: Required
required.description: Set to `true` to indicate that the checkbox must be checked.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Icon to display when the label is active

text.title: Text
text.description: Text to display when the label is active

badge.title: Badge
badge.description: The value of the badge, displayed on the chip.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Set to `true` to disable the chip.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Icon of the chip.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Identifier for the chip. Must be unique.

image.title: Image
image.description: A picture to be displayed instead of the icon on the chip.

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description: Set to `true` to visualize the chip in an "invalid" or "error" state.

language.title: Language
language.description:
Defines the language for translations.
Will translate the translatable strings on the components.

link.title: Link
link.description: If supplied, the chip will become a clickable link.

loading.title: Loading
loading.description:
Set to `true` to put the component in the `loading` state,
and render an indeterminate progress indicator inside the chip.
This does _not_ disable the interactivity of the chip!

menuItems.title: Menu Items
menuItems.description:
When provided, the chip will render an ellipsis menu with the supplied items.
Also, this will hide the "remove button" when `removable={true}`, as
the remove button will automatically become the last item in the menu.

progress.title: Progress
progress.description:
Reflects the current value of a progress bar on the chip,
visualizing the percentage of an ongoing process.
Must be a number between `0` and `100`.

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description:
Set to `true` to render the chip as a static UI element.
Useful when the parent component has a `readonly` state.

removable.title: Removable
removable.description: Set to `true` to render a remove button on the chip.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description:
Set to `true` to visualize the chip in a "selected" state.
This is typically used when the chip is used in a chip-set
along with other chips.

size.title: Size
size.description: Defines the size of the chip.

type.title: Type
type.description:
Set to `filter` to render the chip with a distinct style
suitable for visualizing filters.

alt.title: Alt
alt.description: The alternative text of the image, used to improve accessibility.

loading.title: Loading
loading.description:
The `loading` attribute of the image.
- `lazy` means that the image will be loaded only when it is in the viewport.
- `eager` means that the image will be loaded as soon as possible.

src.title: Src
src.description: The path to the image file.

autocomplete.title: Autocomplete
autocomplete.description:
For chip-set of type `input`, defines whether the input field should have autocomplete enabled.
Read more about the `autocomplete` attribute
[here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete).

clearAllButton.title: Clear All Button
clearAllButton.description: Whether the "Clear all" buttons should be shown

delimiter.title: Delimiter
delimiter.description: For chip-set of type `input`. Sets delimiters between chips.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: True if the chip set should be disabled

emptyInputOnBlur.title: Empty Input On Blur
emptyInputOnBlur.description: Whether the input field should be emptied when the chip-set loses focus.

helperText.title: Helper Text
helperText.description:
Optional helper text to display below the chipset.
When type is `input`, the helper text is displayed below the
input field when it has focus.
When type is not `input`, the helper text is always displayed
if the device is touch screen; otherwise it is shown when chip-set
is hovered or focused using keyboard navigation.

inputType.title: Input Type
inputType.description:
For chip-sets of type `input`. Value to use for the `type` attribute on the
input field inside the chip-set.

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description:
Set to `true` to indicate that the current value of the input field is
invalid.

label.title: Label
label.description: Label for the chip-set

language.title: Language
language.description:
Defines the language for translations.
Will translate the translatable strings on the components. For example, the clear all chips label.

leadingIcon.title: Leading Icon
leadingIcon.description:
For chip-sets of type `input`. When the value is null, no leading icon is used.
Leading icon to show to the far left in the text field

maxItems.title: Max Items
maxItems.description:
For chip-sets of type `input`. Limits the maximum number of chips.
When the value is `0` or not set, no limit is applied.

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description:
For chip-sets of type `input`, set to `true` to disable adding and
removing chips, but allow interaction with existing chips in the set.
For any other types, setting either `readonly` or `disabled` disables
the chip-set.

required.title: Required
required.description: True if the control requires a value

searchLabel.title: Search Label
searchLabel.description: Search label to display when type is `input` and component is in search mode

type.title: Type
type.description:
Type of chip set

- `choice` renders a set of selectable chips where only one is selectable. The `removable` property is ignored
- `filter` renders a set of selectable chips where all are selectable.
- `input` renders a set of chips that can be used in conjunction with an input field

If no type is set, a basic set of chips without additional functionality will be rendered

value.title: Value
value.description: List of chips for the set

href.title: Href
href.description: If supplied, the chip will render a link, using the supplied href.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon to use. Not valid for `filter`.

iconBackgroundColor.title: Icon Background Color
iconBackgroundColor.description: Background color of the icon. Overrides `--icon-background-color`.

id.title: Id
id.description: ID of the chip. Must be unique.

image.title: Image
image.description: A picture to be displayed instead of the icon on the chip.

loading.title: Loading
loading.description:
Set to `true` to put the chip in the `loading` state, and render an
indeterminate progress indicator inside the chip.

menuItems.title: Menu Items
menuItems.description: List of the items to display as in a menu, on the chip.

removable.title: Removable
removable.description: Whether the chip should be removable. Not valid for `choice`.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description: Whether the chip is selected. Only valid for `choice` and `filter`.

text.title: Text
text.description: Text to display inside the chip.

displayPercentageColors.title: Display Percentage Colors
displayPercentageColors.description: When set to `true`, makes the filled section showing the percentage colorful. Colors change with intervals of 10%.

maxValue.title: Max Value
maxValue.description: The maximum value within the scale that the progress bar should visualize. Defaults to `100`.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: The prefix which is displayed before the `value`, must be a few characters characters long.

size.title: Size
size.description: Determines the visual size of the visualization from a preset size. This property can override the `--circular-progress-size` variable if it is specified.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: The suffix which is displayed after the `value`, must be one or two characters long. Defaults to `%`

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the progress bar.

colorScheme.title: Color Scheme
colorScheme.description: Select color scheme for the editor

fold.title: Fold
fold.description: Allows the user to fold code

lineNumbers.title: Line Numbers
lineNumbers.description: Displays line numbers in the editor

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description: Disables editing of the editor content

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: Actions to place to the far right inside the header

header.title: Header
header.description: Text to display in the header of the section

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Icon to display in the header of the section

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description:
`true` if the section is invalid, `false` if valid.
This can be used to indicate that the content inside the section is invalid.

isOpen.title: Is Open
isOpen.description: `true` if the section is expanded, `false` if collapsed.

language.title: Language
language.description:
Defines the language for translations.
Will translate the translatable strings on the components.

helperText.title: Helper Text
helperText.description: Helper text of the input field

label.title: Label
label.description: The label of the input field

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description: Set to `true` if a value is readonly. This makes the component un-interactive.

required.title: Required
required.description: Set to `true` if a value is required

tooltipLabel.title: Tooltip Label
tooltipLabel.description: Displayed as tooltips when picker is hovered.

value.title: Value
value.description: Name or code of the chosen color

helperText.title: Helper Text
helperText.description: Helper text of the input field

label.title: Label
label.description: Label of the input field

required.title: Required
required.description: Set to `true` if a value is required

value.title: Value
value.description: Color value that is manually typed by the user

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description:
Set to `true` to disable the field.
Use `disabled` to indicate that the field can normally be interacted
with, but is currently disabled. This tells the user that if certain
requirements are met, the field may become enabled again.

format.title: Format
format.description: Format to display the selected date in.

formatter.title: Formatter
formatter.description:
Custom formatting function. Will be used for date formatting.

:::note
overrides `format` and `language`
:::

helperText.title: Helper Text
helperText.description: Optional helper text to display below the input field when it has focus

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description:
Set to `true` to indicate that the current value of the date picker is
invalid.

label.title: Label
label.description: Text to display next to the date picker

language.title: Language
language.description:
Defines the localisation for translations and date formatting.
Property `format` customizes the localized date format.

placeholder.title: Placeholder
placeholder.description: The placeholder text shown inside the input field, when the field is focused and empty

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description:
Set to `true` to make the field read-only.
Use `readonly` when the field is only there to present the data it holds,
and will not become possible for the current user to edit.

required.title: Required
required.description: Set to `true` to indicate that the field is required.

closingActions.title: Closing Actions
closingActions.description: Defines which action triggers a close-event.

fullscreen.title: Fullscreen
fullscreen.description: Set to `true` to make the dialog "fullscreen".

heading.title: Heading
heading.description: The heading for the dialog, if any.

open.title: Open
open.description: `true` if the dialog is open, `false` otherwise.

accessibleLabel.title: Accessible Label
accessibleLabel.description:
A label used to describe the purpose of the navigation element to users
of assistive technologies, like screen readers. Especially useful when
there are multiple navigation elements in the user interface.
Example value: "Primary navigation"

allowResize.title: Allow Resize
allowResize.description:
Set to `false` if you do not want to allow end-users
to exapnd or shrink the Dock. This will hide the
expand/shrink button, and the only things that defines
the layout will be the `expanded` property, and
the `mobileBreakPoint`.

dockFooterItems.title: Dock Footer Items
dockFooterItems.description:
Items that are placed at the bottom of the dock. (Or at the end in mobile
layout.)

dockItems.title: Dock Items
dockItems.description: Items that are placed in the dock.

expanded.title: Expanded
expanded.description:
Defines the width of the component, when it loads.
- `true`: shows both icons and labels of the Dock items.
- `false`: only shows icons of the doc items, and displays
their labels as tooltip.

Note: when `useMobileLayout` is `true`, labels will always
be shown as tooltips. Read more belowâ€¦

mobileBreakPoint.title: Mobile Break Point
mobileBreakPoint.description:
Defines the breakpoint in pixles, at which the component will be rendered
in a hoizontal layout. Default breakpoint is `700` pixels, which means
when the screen size is smaller than `700px`, the component will automatically
switch to a horizontal layout.

badge.title: Badge
badge.description: If specified, will display a notification badge on the buttons in the dock.

dockMenu.title: Dock Menu
dockMenu.description: Used to specify a custom component to render as a menu for the dock item.

helperLabel.title: Helper Label
helperLabel.description:
Additional helper text for the dock item.
Example usage can be a keyboard shortcut to activate the dock item.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon to use.

id.title: Id
id.description: A non-changing value to uniquely identify each item.

label.title: Label
label.description: Text to display for the item.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description:
Whether the dock item should indicate it is selected.
These dock items normally take the user to a top-level location within
the navigation tree; for example "Home", "Search" or "MyÂ Account".
Set `selected` to `true`, when:
- the user interface is showing the same top-level location as the dock
item is pointing at, or
- the user interface is showing a page which is a sub-location of the
top-level location. For example, when user is at
_MyÂ AccountÂ âž¡Â NotificationÂ Settings_, the dock item of _MyÂ Account_
should have the `selected` state.

expanded.title: Expanded
expanded.description:
When the dock is expanded or collapsed, dock items
show labels and tooltips as suitable for the layout.

item.title: Item
item.description: Item that is placed in the dock.

useMobileLayout.title: Use Mobile Layout
useMobileLayout.description:
When dock is using mobile layout, dock items
show labels and tooltips as suitable for the layout.

badge.title: Badge
badge.description: If specified, will display a notification badge on the buttons in the dock.

dockMenu.title: Dock Menu
dockMenu.description: Used to specify a custom component to render as a menu for the dock item.

helperLabel.title: Helper Label
helperLabel.description:
Additional helper text for the dock item.
Example usage can be a keyboard shortcut to activate the dock item.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon to use.

id.title: Id
id.description: A non-changing value to uniquely identify each item.

label.title: Label
label.description: Text to display for the item.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description:
Whether the dock item should indicate it is selected.
These dock items normally take the user to a top-level location within
the navigation tree; for example "Home", "Search" or "MyÂ Account".
Set `selected` to `true`, when:
- the user interface is showing the same top-level location as the dock
item is pointing at, or
- the user interface is showing a page which is a sub-location of the
top-level location. For example, when user is at
_MyÂ AccountÂ âž¡Â NotificationÂ Settings_, the dock item of _MyÂ Account_
should have the `selected` state.

defaultLabel.title: Default Label
defaultLabel.description:
The label to display when no matching value is found in the `labels`
array. This is a fallback label that ensures there's always a label
displayed for the component.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description:
A list of available labels. Each label has a corresponding value that
will be matched with the current `value` of the component to determine
what label to display.

value.title: Value
value.description:
The current value of the component which is used to match with the given
`labels` to determine what label to display.

If not matching label is found, the `defaultLabel` is displayed.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Icon to display when the label is active

text.title: Text
text.description: Text to display when the label is active

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: True if the input should be disabled

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description:
Set to `true` to indicate that the current value of the chosen file is
invalid.

label.title: Label
label.description: The input label.

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description:
Set to `true` to disable adding and removing files, but allow interaction
with any already existing file.

required.title: Required
required.description: Set to `true` to indicate that the field is required.

href.title: Href
href.description:
URL where the file can be downloaded. Note that this is optional. If the
file cannot be directly accessed via a unique url, this property should
be left undefined or set to `null`.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon to use.

iconBackgroundColor.title: Icon Background Color
iconBackgroundColor.description: Background color of the icon. Overrides `--icon-background-color`.

id.title: Id
id.description: ID of the file. Must be unique.

menuItems.title: Menu Items
menuItems.description: Custom menu items for the file.

accept.title: Accept
accept.description:
Specifies the types of files that the dropzone will accept. By default, all file types are accepted.

For media files, formats can be specified using: `audio/*`, `video/*`, `image/*`.
Unique file type specifiers can also be used, for example: `.jpg`, `.pdf`.
A comma-separated list of file extensions or MIME types is also acceptable, e.g., `image/png, image/jpeg` or
`.png, .jpg, .jpeg`.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Set to `true` to disable the file dropzone.

helperText.title: Helper Text
helperText.description:
Is displayed to provide supplementary information to the end users,
for instance, which filetypes or file sizes are accepted.

text.title: Text
text.description:
Is displayed when the user is dragging a file over the dropzone.
A suitable text could for instance be "Drop your files here".

accept.title: Accept
accept.description:
Specifies the types of files that the dropzone will accept. By default, all file types are accepted.

For media files, formats can be specified using: `audio/*`, `video/*`, `image/*`.
Unique file type specifiers can also be used, for example: `.jpg`, `.pdf`.
A comma-separated list of file extensions or MIME types is also acceptable, e.g., `image/png, image/jpeg` or
`.png, .jpg, .jpeg`.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Set to `true` to disable file input selection.

multiple.title: Multiple
multiple.description: Set to `true` to enable selection of multiple files

actions.title: Actions
actions.description:
An array of custom actions that can be displayed
as an action menu on the file which is being displayed.

allowDownload.title: Allow Download
allowDownload.description:
Displays a button that allows the user to download the file.
Note that due to the browser's security policies,
the file should be hosted on the same domain
for the download button to work properly.
Not displayed for office files!

allowFullscreen.title: Allow Fullscreen
allowFullscreen.description:
Displays a button that allows the user to view the file
in fullscreen mode.
Not displayed for office files!

allowOpenInNewTab.title: Allow Open In New Tab
allowOpenInNewTab.description:
Displays a button that allows the user to open the file
in a new browser tab.
Not displayed for office files!

alt.title: Alt
alt.description:
An optional alternative text, mainly for assistive technologies and screen readers.
It is used for only image files, as an `alt` attribute.
Should optimally hold a description of the image,
which is also displayed on the page if the image can't be loaded for some reason.

filename.title: Filename
filename.description:
The name of the file that must also contains its extension.
This overrides the filename that the `url` ends with.
Useful when the `url` does not contain the filename.
When specified, the `filename` will be used as filename of
the downloaded file.

officeViewer.title: Office Viewer
officeViewer.description:
Defines the third-party viewer that should be used to render
the content of office files, such as word processing documents,
presentations, or spreadsheets.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: List of actions to display as a menu at the end of the item.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: True if the list item should be disabled.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon to use.

iconColor.title: Icon Color
iconColor.description: Background color of the icon. Overrides `--icon-background-color`.

image.title: Image
image.description: A picture to show on the list item.

primaryComponent.title: Primary Component
primaryComponent.description: Component used to render the list item.

secondaryText.title: Secondary Text
secondaryText.description: Additional supporting text to display in the list item.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description: True if the list item should be selected.

text.title: Text
text.description: Text to display in the list item.

format.title: Format
format.description: Format to display the selected date in.

inputElement.title: Input Element
inputElement.description: The native input element to use with flatpickr.

isOpen.title: Is Open
isOpen.description: Set to `true` if the calendar should be open.

language.title: Language
language.description:
Defines the localisation for translations and date formatting.
Property `format` customizes the localized date format.

align.title: Align
align.description: Specify how items are aligned along the cross axis

justify.title: Justify
justify.description: Specify how items are aligned along the main axis

reverse.title: Reverse
reverse.description: Reverse the order of the items

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Set to `true` to disable the whole form.

errors.title: Errors
errors.description:
Extra errors to display in the form. Typical use case is asynchronous
errors generated server side.

propsFactory.title: Props Factory
propsFactory.description:
Factory for creating properties for custom form components

When using custom components in the form some properties might have to be
set dynamically. If this factory is set, it will be called with the
current schema for the field for each custom component in the form. The
factory must return an object where each key is the name of the property
that should be set, along with its value.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: The schema used to render the form

transformErrors.title: Transform Errors
transformErrors.description: Custom function to customize the default error messages

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Icon to display

subheadingDivider.title: Subheading Divider
subheadingDivider.description:
The visual divider that separates the `subheading` and the `supportingText`.
It must be a single character such as `-` or `,`.

supportingText.title: Supporting Text
supportingText.description: An extra string of text to display along with with the Subheading

href.title: Href
href.description: The url the link should point to.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description:
The `rel` attribute for the link.
Unless explicitly provided, in our components, this is
automatically set to `"noopener noreferrer"`
when `target="_blank"` is used, for improved security.
Providing an empty string will override the default.

target.title: Target
target.description:
Target for the link. See
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target
for more info.

text.title: Text
text.description:
The text value to use for the link.
Note that this might not be used by all components that use the
Link interface.

title.title: Title
title.description:
Title for the link. Read by assistive tech and shown when the
link is hovered. Can be used to provide additional information
about the link. It improves accessibility both for sighted users
and users of assistive technologies.

href.title: Href
href.description: The url the link should point to.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description:
The `rel` attribute for the link.
Unless explicitly provided, in our components, this is
automatically set to `"noopener noreferrer"`
when `target="_blank"` is used, for improved security.
Providing an empty string will override the default.

target.title: Target
target.description:
Target for the link. See
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target
for more info.

text.title: Text
text.description:
The text value to use for the link.
Note that this might not be used by all components that use the
Link interface.

title.title: Title
title.description:
Title for the link. Read by assistive tech and shown when the
link is hovered. Can be used to provide additional information
about the link. It improves accessibility both for sighted users
and users of assistive technologies.

helperText.title: Helper Text
helperText.description: The helper text that is displayed on the left side.

helperTextId.title: Helper Text Id
helperTextId.description: Used by `aria-controls` and `aria-describedby` in the parent component.

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description:
Turns `true`, when the parent component is invalid.
For example, when the parent component is `required` but is left empty.
Or when the input format is invalid.

length.title: Length
length.description:
Length of the current input value, coming from the parent component.
Used in the character counter section on the right side.

maxLength.title: Max Length
maxLength.description:
Maximum length of the characters, defined on the parent component.
Used in the character counter section on the right side.

badge.title: Badge
badge.description:
Set to `true` to give the icon a round background with some padding.
Only works when the `size` attribute is also set.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Set to `true` to disable the button.

elevated.title: Elevated
elevated.description:
Set to `true` to give the button our standard "elevated" look, lifting
it off the flat layout.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: The icon to display.

label.title: Label
label.description: The text to show to screenreaders and other assistive tech.

badge.title: Badge
badge.description: If supplied, the info tile will display a notification badge.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Set to `true` if info tile is disabled.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of icon for the info tile.

label.title: Label
label.description: The text to show below the info tile. Long labels will be truncated.

link.title: Link
link.description:
If supplied, the info tile will be a clickable link.

Supplying a value also adds an elevated effect using a shadow,
as well as `cursor: pointer`, which appears on hover.
While we strongly recommend supplying a link whenever the
component should act as a link, if this is not possible, and
you need to provide interaction through a click handler,
you can still get the correct styling by supplying a `Link`
object with the `href` property set to `'#'`.

loading.title: Loading
loading.description:
Set to `true` to put the component in the `loading` state.
This does _not_ disable the link. To do so, the
`disabled` property should be set to `true` as well.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: A string of text that is visually placed before the value.

progress.title: Progress
progress.description:
Properties of the optional circular progress bar.

Defaults:
- `maxValue`: 100
- `suffix`: %
- `displayPercentageColors`: false

Colors change with intervals of 10 %.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: A string of text that is visually placed after the value.

value.title: Value
value.description:
A piece of text or number that is the main piece of information
which the component is intended to visualize.

displayPercentageColors.title: Display Percentage Colors
displayPercentageColors.description: When set to `true`, the progress bar changes color depending on its current value.

maxValue.title: Max Value
maxValue.description: The maximum value within the scale that the progress bar should visualize.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description:
The prefix which is displayed before the `progressValue`.
Keep to a few characters at most.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: The suffix which is displayed after the `value`, must be one or two characters long.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the progress bar.

href.title: Href
href.description: The url the link should point to.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description:
The `rel` attribute for the link.
Unless explicitly provided, in our components, this is
automatically set to `"noopener noreferrer"`
when `target="_blank"` is used, for improved security.
Providing an empty string will override the default.

target.title: Target
target.description:
Target for the link. See
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target
for more info.

text.title: Text
text.description:
The text value to use for the link.
Note that this might not be used by all components that use the
Link interface.

title.title: Title
title.description:
Title for the link. Read by assistive tech and shown when the
link is hovered. Can be used to provide additional information
about the link. It improves accessibility both for sighted users
and users of assistive technologies.

completions.title: Completions
completions.description: list of suggestions `value` can autocomplete to.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description:
Set to `true` to disable the field.
Use `disabled` to indicate that the field can normally be interacted
with, but is currently disabled. This tells the user that if certain
requirements are met, the field may become enabled again.

formatNumber.title: Format Number
formatNumber.description:
Set to `true` to format the current value of the input field only
if the field is of type number.
The number format is determined by the current language of the browser.

helperText.title: Helper Text
helperText.description: Optional helper text to display below the input field when it has focus

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description:
Set to `true` to indicate that the current value of the input field is
invalid.

label.title: Label
label.description: The input label.

leadingIcon.title: Leading Icon
leadingIcon.description: Leading icon to show to the far left in the field.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: The locale to use for formatting numbers.

max.title: Max
max.description: Maximum allowed value if input type is `number`.

maxlength.title: Maxlength
maxlength.description:
Maximum length of the value if type is `password`, `search`, `tel`,
`text`, `url`, or `urlAsText`.

min.title: Min
min.description: Minimum allowed value if input type is `number`.

minlength.title: Minlength
minlength.description:
Minimum length of the value if type is `password`, `search`, `tel`,
`text`, `url`, or `urlAsText`.

pattern.title: Pattern
pattern.description:
Regular expression that the current value of the input field must match.
No forward slashes should be specified around the pattern.
Only used if type is `text`, `tel`, `email`, `url`, `urlAsText`,
`password`, or `search`.

placeholder.title: Placeholder
placeholder.description: The placeholder text shown inside the input field, when the field is focused and empty.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description:
A short piece of text to display before the value inside the input field.
Displayed for all types except `textarea`.

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description:
Set to `true` to make the field read-only.
Use `readonly` when the field is only there to present the data it holds,
and will not become possible for the current user to edit.

required.title: Required
required.description: Set to `true` to indicate that the field is required.

showLink.title: Show Link
showLink.description:
For inputs of type `email`, `tel`, `url`, and `urlAsText`, set this to
`true` to show a trailing icon with a `mailto:`,`tel:`, or normal link,
respectively. The default icon can be overridden using the `trailingIcon`
property.

step.title: Step
step.description: Incremental values that are valid if the field type is `number`.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description:
A short piece of text to display after the value inside the input field.
Displayed for all types except `textarea`.

trailingIcon.title: Trailing Icon
trailingIcon.description: Trailing icon to show to the far right in the field.

type.title: Type
type.description:
Type of input.

Note** regarding type `url`: `limel-input` uses the native validation
built into the browser for many types of input fields. The native
validation for `url` is very strict, and does not allow relative urls,
nor any other formats that are not a "fully qualified" url. To allow
such urls, use the type `urlAsText` instead. `urlAsText` works exactly
like `text` in all regards, except that it enables use of the `showLink`
property.

accessibleLabel.title: Accessible Label
accessibleLabel.description:
A label used to describe the purpose of the element to users
of assistive technologies, like screen readers.
If not provided, the generic word of "Progress bar" will be used.

indeterminate.title: Indeterminate
indeterminate.description: Puts the progress bar in an indeterminate state

language.title: Language
language.description:
Defines the language for translations.
Will translate the translatable strings on the components.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of the progress bar. Should be between `0` and `1`.

badgeIcons.title: Badge Icons
badgeIcons.description: Set to `true` if the list should display larger icons with a background

iconSize.title: Icon Size
iconSize.description: Size of the icons in the list

maxLinesSecondaryText.title: Max Lines Secondary Text
maxLinesSecondaryText.description:
By default, lists will display 3 lines of text, and then truncate the rest.
Consumers can increase or decrease this number by specifying
`maxLinesSecondaryText`. If consumer enters zero or negative
numbers we default to 1; and if they type decimals we round up.

type.title: Type
type.description:
The type of the list, omit to get a regular list. Available types are:
`selectable`: regular list with single selection.
`radio`: radio button list with single selection.
`checkbox`: checkbox list with multiple selection.

value.title: Value
value.description:
The input text. Treated as GitHub Flavored Markdown, with the addition
that any included HTML will be parsed and rendered as HTML, rather than
as text.

whitelist.title: Whitelist
whitelist.description:
Whitelisted html elements.

Any custom element added here will not be sanitized and thus rendered.
Can also be set via `limel-config`. Setting this property will override
the global config.

badgeIcons.title: Badge Icons
badgeIcons.description: Defines whether the menu should show badges.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Sets the disabled state of the menu.

emptyResultMessage.title: Empty Result Message
emptyResultMessage.description: Message to display when search returns 0 results.

gridLayout.title: Grid Layout
gridLayout.description: Renders list items in a grid layout, rather than a vertical list

items.title: Items
items.description: A list of items and separators to show in the menu.

open.title: Open
open.description: Sets the open state of the menu.

openDirection.title: Open Direction
openDirection.description: Decides the menu's location in relation to its trigger

rootItem.title: Root Item
rootItem.description:
A root breadcrumb item to show above the menu items.
Clicking it navigates back from a sub-menu to the root menu.

searcher.title: Searcher
searcher.description:
A search function that takes a search-string as an argument,
and returns a promise that will eventually be resolved with
an array of `MenuItem`:s.

See the docs for the type `MenuSearcher` for type information on
the searcher function itself.

surfaceWidth.title: Surface Width
surfaceWidth.description: Decides the width of menu's dropdown

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Icon of the step.

link.title: Link
link.description: If supplied, the breadcrumbs steps will be a clickable links.

type.title: Type
type.description:
If set to `icon-only`, the `text` will be rendered as a tooltip
and the item will only display the defined `icon`.

badgeIcons.title: Badge Icons
badgeIcons.description: Set to `true` if the list should display larger icons with a background

iconSize.title: Icon Size
iconSize.description: Size of the icons in the list

maxLinesSecondaryText.title: Max Lines Secondary Text
maxLinesSecondaryText.description:
By default, lists will display 3 lines of text, and then truncate the rest.
Consumers can increase or decrease this number by specifying
`maxLinesSecondaryText`. If consumer enters zero or negative
numbers we default to 1; and if they type decimals we round up.

allowClicksElement.title: Allow Clicks Element
allowClicksElement.description: Clicks in this element should not be prevented when the menu surface is open

open.title: Open
open.description: True if the menu surface is open, false otherwise

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description:
Set to `true` to indicate that the input element is
disabled. This applies proper visual styles, such as making the outlines
and the label transparent.

hasFloatingLabel.title: Has Floating Label
hasFloatingLabel.description:
Set to `true` when the consumer element needs to render the
label above the input element, despite existence of a `value`.
For example in the `text-editor` or `limel-select`,
where the default layout requires a floating label.

hasLeadingIcon.title: Has Leading Icon
hasLeadingIcon.description:
Set to `true` when the consumer element displays a leading icon.
This applies proper visual styles, such as rendering the label
correctly placed beside the leading icon.

hasValue.title: Has Value
hasValue.description:
Set to `true` when the user has entered a value for the input element,
shrinking the label in size, and visually rendering it above the entered value.

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description:
Set to `true` to indicate that the current value of the input element is
invalid. This applies proper visual styles, such as making the outlines red.

label.title: Label
label.description:
Label to display for the input element.
:::important
Note that the input element of the consumer component will be
labeled by this label, using the `labelId` prop.
:::

labelId.title: Label Id
labelId.description:
The `id` of the input element which should be
labeled by the provided label.

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description:
Set to `true` when the input element is readonly.
This applies proper visual styles, such as making the outline transparent.

required.title: Required
required.description:
Set to `true` when the input element is required.
This applies proper visual styles, such as inclusion of an asterisk
beside the label.

actionPosition.title: Action Position
actionPosition.description:
Position of the custom static actions in the picker's results dropdown.
Can be set to `'top'` or `'bottom'`.

actionScrollBehavior.title: Action Scroll Behavior
actionScrollBehavior.description:
Scroll behavior of the custom static actions, when user scrolls
in the picker's results dropdown. Can be set to `'scroll'` which means
the action items will scroll together with the list, or `'sticky'` which
retains their position at the top or bottom of the drop down while
scrolling.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: Static actions that can be clicked by the user.

allItems.title: All Items
allItems.description:
Only used if no `searcher` is provided. The picker will then use a
default search function that filters the `allItems` based on the
`text` and `secondaryText` properties of the items.
This way, custom search functions are typically only needed when the
search is done on the server.
For performance reasons, the default searcher will never return more
than 20 items, but if there are more than 20 items, the rest can be
found by typing more characters in the search field.

badgeIcons.title: Badge Icons
badgeIcons.description: Whether badge icons should be used in the result list or not

delimiter.title: Delimiter
delimiter.description: Sets delimiters between chips. Works only when `multiple` is `true`.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: True if the picker should be disabled

emptyResultMessage.title: Empty Result Message
emptyResultMessage.description: A message to display when the search returned an empty result

helperText.title: Helper Text
helperText.description: Optional helper text to display below the input field when it has focus

invalid.title: Invalid
invalid.description:
Set to `true` to indicate that the current value of the input field is
invalid.

label.title: Label
label.description: Text to display for the input field of the picker

leadingIcon.title: Leading Icon
leadingIcon.description: Leading icon to show to the far left in the text field

multiple.title: Multiple
multiple.description: True if multiple values are allowed

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description:
Set to `true` to disable adding and removing items,
but allow interaction with existing items.

required.title: Required
required.description: True if the control requires a value

searchLabel.title: Search Label
searchLabel.description: Search label to display in the input field when searching

searcher.title: Searcher
searcher.description:
A search function that takes a search-string as an argument,
and returns a promise that will eventually be resolved with
an array of `ListItem`:s.

See the docs for the type `Searcher` for type information on
the searcher function itself.

value.title: Value
value.description: Currently selected value or values. Where the value can be an object.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: List of actions to display as a menu at the end of the item.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: True if the list item should be disabled.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon to use.

iconColor.title: Icon Color
iconColor.description: Background color of the icon. Overrides `--icon-background-color`.

image.title: Image
image.description: A picture to show on the list item.

primaryComponent.title: Primary Component
primaryComponent.description: Component used to render the list item.

secondaryText.title: Secondary Text
secondaryText.description: Additional supporting text to display in the list item.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description: True if the list item should be selected.

text.title: Text
text.description: Text to display in the list item.

open.title: Open
open.description: True if the content within the popover should be visible

openDirection.title: Open Direction
openDirection.description: Decides the popover's location in relation to its trigger

anchor.title: Anchor
anchor.description:
The element that the content should be positioned relative to.
Defaults to the limel-portal element.

containerStyle.title: Container Style
containerStyle.description: Dynamic styling that can be applied to the container holding the content.

inheritParentWidth.title: Inherit Parent Width
inheritParentWidth.description:
Used to make a dropdown have the same width as the trigger, for example
in `limel-picker`.

openDirection.title: Open Direction
openDirection.description: Decides which direction the portal content should open.

visible.title: Visible
visible.description:
True if the content within the portal should be visible.

If the content is from within a dialog for instance, this can be set to
true from false when the dialog opens to position the content properly.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description:
Set to `true` to disable the progress flow.
Use `disabled` to indicate that the component can normally be interacted
with, but is currently disabled. This tells the user that if certain
requirements are met, the field may become enabled again.

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description:
Disables the progress flow when `true`.
This does not visualize the component that much differently.
But since the component does not provide any feedback that users can
interact with the component, it makes it perfect for illustrative and
informative porpuses.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: List of actions to display as a menu at the end of the item.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: True if the list item should be disabled.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon to use.

iconColor.title: Icon Color
iconColor.description:
Fill color of the icon on the step,
when it is neither selected nor passed.

image.title: Image
image.description: A picture to show on the list item.

isOffProgress.title: Is Off Progress
isOffProgress.description:
Determines whether a step should be a part of the flow,
or should be an independent step visually located on the side.

passedColor.title: Passed Color
passedColor.description: Background color of the step, when it is passed.

primaryComponent.title: Primary Component
primaryComponent.description: Component used to render the list item.

secondaryText.title: Secondary Text
secondaryText.description: Additional supporting text to display in the list item.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description: True if the list item should be selected.

text.title: Text
text.description: Text to display in the list item.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: True if the flow item should be disabled

item.title: Item
item.description: The flow item that should be rendered

readonly.title: Readonly
readonly.description: True if the flow item should be readonly

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: List of actions to display as a menu at the end of the item.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: True if the list item should be disabled.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon to use.

iconColor.title: Icon Color
iconColor.description:
Fill color of the icon on the step,
when it is neither selected nor passed.

image.title: Image
image.description: A picture to show on the list item.

isOffProgress.title: Is Off Progress
isOffProgress.description:

Defines the layout of the table, based on how width of the columns are calculated.

- `default`: makes columns as wide as their contents.
- `stretchLastColumn`: makes columns as wide as their contents, stretch the last column to fill up the remaining table width.
- `stretchColumns`: stretches all columns to fill the available width when possible.
- `lowDensity`: makes columns as wide as their contents, and creates a low density and airy layout.

required.description:

triggers.title: Triggers
triggers.description:
A set of trigger characters

Defining a character here will enable trigger events to be sent if the
character is detected in the editor.

ui.title: Ui
ui.description:
Specifies the visual appearance of the editor.

- `standard`: The default editor appearance with a full toolbar and
   standard layout.
- `minimal`: A compact editor appearance, ideal for limited space
   scenarios such as mobile devices. In this mode, the toolbar is hidden
   until the editor is focused.
- `no-toolbar`: A basic textarea appearance without any text styling toolbar.
   This mode is suitable for scenarios where you want to provide a simple
   text input without any visible formatting options; but still provide
   support for markdown syntax and rich text, using hotkeys or when pasting.

'helperLabel' in two rows.

openDirection.title: Open Direction
openDirection.description: Decides the tooltip's location in relation to its trigger.

documents.title: Action bar
text:
An action bar is a user interface element commonly found in software applications and websites.
It typically appears at the top of the screen or within a specific section
and serves as a centralized hub for accessing various actions and commands
relevant to the current context or page.

The action bar often contains a set of clickable icons or buttons (icons + labels)
that represent specific actions, such as saving, deleting, editing, sharing,
or bulk operations for selected items.

The purpose of an action bar is to provide quick and convenient access to
frequently used functionalities, enabling users to perform common tasks efficiently.
It enhances usability by organizing important actions in a visually prominent and easily accessible location.

The action bar's design and layout can vary based on the platform or application,
but its primary goal remains consistentâ€”to
empower users to interact with the software and perform desired actions effortlessly.

Basic Example

An action bar is typically placed on top of a page or section,
displaying multiple buttons in a row.
Separators can be added to visually group related actions.

:::tip
By default, when `layout="fullWidth"`, all actions will be placed on
the left side of the action bar,
but you can override this default behavior by
adding `justify-content: flex-end;`.
:::

Overflow menu
When the action bar items don't fit in the available space,
an overflow button is automatically added as the last item on the action bar.

The menu indicates the quantity of the actions which are currently invisible for the users.
Clicking on the overflow button opens a menu with the remaining actions that didn't fit
in the available space.

Selected item
For some use cases, one or more items in the action bar could
get a `selected` state. This is useful for example when you want to
highlight a currently active item in a list of items.

Using colors

You can specify colors for single actions, by setting `color` on the `icon`.

:::note
Make sure not to overuse colors!
It is perfectly fine that most of the actions in the bar use the default color.
Colors should be used to add an extra layer of meaning for the actions.
:::

Floating Example

For some designs, it may make sense to display the action bar as
a floating element on top of the page's content.
Set the `layout` prop to `floating` to get the basics styles of
a floating bar.

:::note
1. In this case, the action bar gets some elevation effect
using a `box-shadow`. This is to properly separate the action bar
form its surrounding context. You can override this by setting another
`box-shadow`.
2. Make sure to use a proper `openDirection` for the
overflow menu.
3. Make sure there is space on the sides of the action bar,
so that it doesn't stretch out completely from left edge to the right
edge. The component is already doing so using a `max-width`,
but you can override it by providing another `max-width`.
:::

Floating action bar with expand button

Some designs may require a floating action bar with an expand button.
It can be useful if action bar is covering important content.
To make the action bar expandable, set the `collapsible` prop to `true`.

Styling

Using provided custom CSS properties,
it is possible to style the action bar.

:::note
The `--action-bar-item-icon-color` affects all icons.
However, the `color` specified for `icon` for individual items
will override that.
:::

Creative usage
Since the action bar can automatically overflow actions which do not
fit into the available width, it makes the component a good candidate
for providing contextual actions within small sections of a user interface.

:::important
For this specific usage (`limel-action-bar` as a primary component in `limel-list`)
the certain styles are required for the overflow menu to properly work.
See the linked CSS file!

There should be a `min-width` and `max-width` on the component in order to prevent
the overflow menu to cause infinite rendering loops.
:::

Proper usage of the `title` property in the `Icon` interface

In some scenarios, the `title` property of the item's icon must be used to
improve accessibility for unsighted users.

In most cases, the item's `text` is descriptive enough for the users to understand
the meaning of the action. In such cases, the icon is primarily used to improve
the visual appearance of the item, and make it more quickly and easily recognizable
for the users.

However, some designs favor a cleaner and more minimal user interface,
by removing unnecessary words, relying on an already present icon which
can be interpreted as a word by the user.

Here you see examples of such icons followed by a short text:
- **âž• icon followed by "Todo"**: For a sighted user,
this combination of icon and text would be interpreted as "Add New Todo"
- **ðŸ”„ icon followed by "List"**: Would be visually read as "Refresh List"
- **ðŸ—‘ï¸ icon followed by "Selected"**: Would be visually read as "Delete Selected"

For sighted users, the text is enough to understand the meaning of the action,
but a screen reader cannot interpret the icon as a word, unless you provide a
proper `title` property for the icon. In fact, the icons that have no `title`
are completely hidden from the screen readers.

This example showcases how user experience can be improved not only for both
users of assistive technologies, but also for those who see a descriptive tooltip,
while hovering the action, which is constructed from the combination of
the `title` and `text`.

props.name: accessibleLabel
props.text:
A label used to describe the purpose of the element to users
of assistive technologies, like screen readers.
Example value: "toolbar"

props.name: actions
props.text:
Items that are placed in the action bar.
These represent primary actions.

props.name: collapsible
props.text: When set to `true`, the action bar will be collapsible.

props.name: language
props.text: Defines the language for translations.

props.name: layout
props.text:
- When set to `fullWidth`, the component will take the
entire width of its container.
- When set to `floating`, the component will get basic stylings
to visualize the floating state.
:::note
You should still properly position the component
according to the structure of your user interface.
For example, use an `absolute` or `fixed` position.
:::

props.name: openDirection
props.text:
Defines the location that the content of the overflow menu
appears, in relation to its trigger.

events.name: itemSelected
events.text: Fired when a action bar item has been clicked.

documents.title: Badge
text:
The Badge component can be used to display a notification badge,
optionally with a number or a text label.

Badge without a `label`
When no `label` is provided, the badge will only render as a circle.
This is a convention which is used in many applications to attract the
user's attention to a certain element on the user interface; typically to
menus or buttons that navigate the user to another pane or screen.

In such cases, the idea is to provide the users with a "red thread"
and help them find something that requires their attention, but is located
on another place in the app, and not directly visible.

:::tip
Make sure that the dot is noticeable, by providing an
eye-catching background color, as shown in this example.
:::

Number badges

Numeric labels larger than 999 will get both rounded and abbreviated.
For example, if the label is `1090` the badge will display `1.1K`.
Abbreviation units used are `k` (Kilo) that stands for Thousands,
`M` for Millions, `B` for Billions, and `T` for Trillions.

When users hover the abbreviated badge, the complete
`label` will be displayed in a tooltip.

String badges

String labels get truncated if their visual length is longer than
six characters placed side by side (six `0`s to be exact).

When users hover the truncated badge, the complete
`label` will be displayed in a tooltip.

props.name: label
props.text:
Label to display in the badge.
Numeric labels larger than 999 will be rounded and abbreviated.
String labels get truncated if their length is longer than
six characters.
